title: Research Associate
text:
Hours per week : full time 
You will study the production of a novel class of biopharmaceuticals called therapeutic catalytic antibodies (or ‘abzymes’). This feasibility study aims to answer whether abzymes can fulfil their clinical promise given the novel techniques now available in antibody research. This 12 month project will be supervised by Professor Nigel Scrutton (Director of the Manchester Institute of Biotechnology) and will involve working with collaborators at the biopharmaceutical company UCB. You will join an established lab of over 30 researchers specialising in the catalytic power of enzymes. 
You will hold a PhD (or equivalent) in biotechnology, molecular biology or enzymology (or a related subject area), and have technical skills in recombinant DNA techniques and bioscreening. 
The University of Manchester values a diverse workforce and welcomes applications from all sections of the community. 
Enquiries about the vacancy, shortlisting and interviews:Dr Louise Barnes, Research Development Manager
